question: Which country houses "Erta Ale" volcano?
explanation: Erta Ale is a 613 meters high continuously active basaltic shield volcano located in the Erta Ale mountain range in the Afar region of Ethiopia. It is the most active volcano in Ethiopia. This volcanic mountain is famous for housing the longest-existing lava lake. This mountain is also known as the "Smoking Mountain " and "gateway to hell". It is part of the East African Rift System.
